meanings.definition: A person who is equal to another in abilities, qualifications, age, background, or social status.
meanings.sent1: My friend is my peer in school because we are in the same grade.
meanings.sent2: In the workplace, it is important to treat your peers with respect.
meanings.sent3: During the game, I found out that my peer had the same high score as me.
meanings.sent4: She considered her twin sister as her peer in every aspect of life.
meanings.sent5: The team captain saw potential in the new player and welcomed them as a peer.

meanings.definition: To look keenly or with difficulty at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I had to peer through the fog to see the road ahead clearly.
meanings.sent2: The detective tried to peer into the dark alley to catch a glimpse of the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat would often peer through the window to watch the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the hiker peered into the distance to find a suitable camping spot.
meanings.sent5: She had to peer closely at the tiny print to read the fine details of the contract.
